trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Azure <link><linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Azure <link><linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: On the command bar, click New.
trans-unit.target: On the command bar, click New.

trans-unit.source: Click Virtual Machine, and then click From Gallery.
trans-unit.target: Click Virtual Machine, and then click From Gallery.

trans-unit.source: From Choose an Image, select an image from one of the lists.
trans-unit.target: From Choose an Image, select an image from one of the lists.

trans-unit.source: (The available images may differ depending on the subscription you're using.)
trans-unit.target: (The available images may differ depending on the subscription you're using.)

trans-unit.source: Click the arrow to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the arrow to continue.

trans-unit.source: If multiple versions of the image are available, in Version Release Date, pick the version you want to use.
trans-unit.target: If multiple versions of the image are available, in Version Release Date, pick the version you want to use.

trans-unit.source: In Virtual Machine Name, type the name that you want to use.
trans-unit.target: In Virtual Machine Name, type the name that you want to use.

trans-unit.source: For this virtual machine, type MyTestVM1.
trans-unit.target: For this virtual machine, type MyTestVM1.

trans-unit.source: In Size, select the size that you want to use for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In Size, select the size that you want to use for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The size that you choose depends on the number of cores that are needed for your application.
trans-unit.target: The size that you choose depends on the number of cores that are needed for your application.

trans-unit.source: For this virtual machine, choose the smallest available size.
trans-unit.target: For this virtual machine, choose the smallest available size.

trans-unit.source: In New User Name, type the name of the account that you will use to administer the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In New User Name, type the name of the account that you will use to administer the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You cannot use root for the user name.
trans-unit.target: You cannot use root for the user name.

trans-unit.source: For this virtual machine, type NewUser1.
trans-unit.target: For this virtual machine, type NewUser1.

trans-unit.source: Under Authentication, check Provide a Password.
trans-unit.target: Under Authentication, check Provide a Password.

trans-unit.source: Then, provide the required information and click the arrow to continue.
trans-unit.target: Then, provide the required information and click the arrow to continue.

trans-unit.source: You can place virtual machines together in the cloud service, but for this tutorial, you're only creating a single virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: You can place virtual machines together in the cloud service, but for this tutorial, you're only creating a single virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: To do this, select Create a new cloud service.
trans-unit.target: To do this, select Create a new cloud service.

trans-unit.source: In Cloud Service DNS Name, type a name that uses between 3 and 24 lowercase letters and numbers.
trans-unit.target: In Cloud Service DNS Name, type a name that uses between 3 and 24 lowercase letters and numbers.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to come up with your own cloud service name because it must be unique in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to come up with your own cloud service name because it must be unique in Azure.

trans-unit.source: The clouse service name becomes part of the URI that is used to contact the virtual machine through the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: The clouse service name becomes part of the URI that is used to contact the virtual machine through the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: In Region/Affinity Group/Virtual Network, select where you want to locate the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In Region/Affinity Group/Virtual Network, select where you want to locate the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can select a storage account where the VHD file is stored.
trans-unit.target: You can select a storage account where the VHD file is stored.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, accept the default setting of Use an Automatically Generated Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, accept the default setting of Use an Automatically Generated Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: Under Availability Set, for the purposes of this tutorial use the default setting of None.
trans-unit.target: Under Availability Set, for the purposes of this tutorial use the default setting of None.

trans-unit.source: Under Endpoints, review the endpoint that's automatically created to allow Secure Shell (SSH) connections to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Under Endpoints, review the endpoint that's automatically created to allow Secure Shell (SSH) connections to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: (Endpoints allow resources on the Internet or other virtual networks to communicate with a virtual machine.)
trans-unit.target: (Endpoints allow resources on the Internet or other virtual networks to communicate with a virtual machine.)

trans-unit.source: You can add more endpoints now, or create them later.
trans-unit.target: You can add more endpoints now, or create them later.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on creating them later, see <link><linkText>How to Set Up Endpoints to a Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on creating them later, see <link><linkText>How to Set Up Endpoints to a Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Under VM Agent, review the available extensions.
trans-unit.target: Under VM Agent, review the available extensions.

trans-unit.source: These extensions provide various features that make it easier to use and manage a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: These extensions provide various features that make it easier to use and manage a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure VM Extensions</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure VM Extensions</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: After Azure creates the virtual machine and cloud service, the Management Portal lists the new virtual machine under Virtual Machines and lists the cloud service under Cloud Services.
trans-unit.target: After Azure creates the virtual machine and cloud service, the Management Portal lists the new virtual machine under Virtual Machines and lists the cloud service under Cloud Services.

trans-unit.source: Both the virtual machine and the cloud service are started automatically.
trans-unit.target: Both the virtual machine and the cloud service are started automatically.
